intro: Diascia stricta, commonly known as the common diascia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and produces small, showy blooms throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its stems are sturdy and often branching. Diascia stricta is well-suited for rock gardens and containers due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
